Verus Vault allows you to time lock and unlock an identity in a single operation. This means you can set an unlock height, which defines the block height at which the identity will be unlocked. ```
**Time Delay:**
In addition to time locking, Verus Vault also allows you to set a time delay on an identity. This defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.

To set a time delay on an identity using the Verus command line, you can use the following command:
```

```
**Important Notes:**

* Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height.
* A locked identity cannot revoke itself.
